bug.short_desc: Software update does not work in Windows Vista when eclipse is installed in program files and UAC is active

long_desc.thetext: On a Windows Vista with the UAC (User Access Control) activated, if eclipse is installed in Program files, the software update does not work unless you start eclipse with the 'Run as administrator' option. This also happens for RCP applications in general. It would be nice to have a launcher that supports the UAC issue.

I just can't believe I just found out about this. I lost many potential customers who couldn't get my software installed.
This has to be fixed. At least, P2 should warn that the files cannot be written. This is a very serious bug and it is hurting unsuspecting users. Especially because the plugins appear to be installed.
This should get higher priority!

This wasn't supported in Eclipse 3.3 and will likely never be supported by classic Update Manager that was used in the 3.3 and earlier releases. However since Eclipse 3.4 we have used a new provisioning system that does support Vista UAC. See bug 215917 for some information on this. So, if you are using Eclipse 3.4 or greater, please file a new bug about your particular problem. For the Eclipse platform and SDK it works just fine, but if your RCP application is not working then it likely isn't configured properly.
